snippet: The New York City Opera, which has been seeking to forge a new identity since casting off from Lincoln Center two seasons ago, will shed the sets and costumes of many of its old productions.
abstract: New York City Opera plans to sell or otherwise dispose of sets and costumes from many past productions in order to save the cost of storage.
lead_paragraph: The New York City Opera, which has been seeking to forge a new identity since casting off from Lincoln Center two seasons ago, will shed the sets and costumes of many of its old productions.

headline.seo: City Opera to Dispose of Former Productions
headline.main: City Opera Is to Shed Its Past, Not Store It
headline.print_headline: City Opera Is to Shed Its Past, Not Store It
